RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Cincia da Computao pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2001), mestrado em Cincia da Computao pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2003) e doutorado pela Universidade da California em Los Angeles (2008). Tem experincia na rea de Cincia da Computao, com nfase em Linguagens de Programao. Interesses incluem sistemas de objetos distribudos, alocao de registradores e teoria da computao.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelor in Computer Science from the Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2001). Master in Computer Science from the Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2003). PhD by the University of California, Los Angeles (2008). Fernando's research interests include programming languages in general, with particular emphasis on distributed systems, register allocation and theory of computer science.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Nosso objetivo desenvolver compiladores capazes de traduzir programas sequenciais para programas capazes de serem executados em paralelo.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Our objective is to develop compilation techniques that are able to automatically produce parallel code from sequential programs.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: O objetivo da pesquisa em compiladores desenvolver mtodos e teorias que possibilitem a melhora, de forma automtica de programas. Dentre essas anlises citam-se as otimizaes de laos, as anlises de ponteiros, a alocao de registradores e a proteo de cdigo.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: The goal of compiler research is to develop techniques and theories that improve the binary code produced by compilers. These analyses and optimizations include loop optimizations, pointer analyses, register allocation and code protection.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de um ambiente para gerao de compiladores baseados em descries semnticas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto foi desenvolvido como Iniciao Cientfica e foi defendido como Projeto Orientado em Computao (projeto obrigatrio de final de curso) pelo autor. Consistiu na implementao de um ambiente no qual linguagens de programao podem ser descritas mediante a descrio denotacional das mesmas. Tais descries so, posteriormente, traduzidas para cdigo Haskell e executadas.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de uma linguagem para coordenao de aplicaes em redes mveis ad-hoc.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto consistiu na implementao de um modelo de coordenao de aplicaes em redes mveis ad-hoc. Este modelo, denominado PeerSpaces, permite que os vrios componentes que integram uma rede ad-hoc se comuniquem sem que seja necessria a existncia de uma estrutura de localizao centralizada, tal qual se d em sistemas de middleware tradicionais, como CORBA e Java RMI. O modelo PeerSpaces baseado em uma estrutura de dados conhecida como espao de tuplas, orinalmente empregada na linguagem Linda para prover coordenao entre processos concorrentes.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto e implementao de um Arcabouo para o desenvolvimento de plataformas de middleware.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto consistiu na especificao e implementao de Arcademis: um arcabouo para o desenvolvimento de plataformas de middleware orientadas por objetos. A partir de Arcademis podem ser derivadas plataformas de middleware no monolticas e facilmente configurveis, que podem ser utilizadas para suportar aplicaes especficas, como sistemas para computao mvel e de tempo real. Por exemplo, Arcademis foi utilizado na implementao de RME, uma plataforma de middleware que fornece para o perfil CLDC de J2ME um servio de invocao remota de mtodos. Este projeto foi realizado como pesquisa de mestrado.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Otimizao de Cdigo para Placas Grficas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O objetivo deste grupo de pesquisa permitir, via o desenvolvimento de tcnicas de gerao e otimizao de cdigo, que desenvolvedores de programas melhor usufruam do alto poder de processamento de arquiteturas computacionais paralelas. Tais tcnicas possibilitam, portanto, que estes desenvolvedores possam se concentrar em problemas algortmicos, trabalhando com linguagens de programao de alto nvel, enquanto o compilador lhes garante a utilizao eficiente do hardware. A pesquisa em compilao para arquiteturas de alto desempenho, no DCC-UFMG, d-se em duas vertentes. Em primeiro lugar, desenvolvem-se estratgias de "paralelizao automtica de cdigo". O objetivo deste tipo de pesquisa transformar programas que foram concebidos para hardware monoprocessado em cdigo equivalente que seja mais eficiente por ser capaz de utilizar diversos processadores simultaneamente. Em segundo lugar, este grupo de pesquisa desenvolve tcnicas de otimizao de programas que se aplicam diretamente melhoria de aplicaes paralelas. Neste caso, destacam-se, por exemplo, as transformaes de cdigo realizadas automaticamente pelo compilador a fim de remover barreiras de sincronizao redundantes, coordenar acesso memria compartilhada e aumentar o nmero de processadores em execuo simultnea.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Otimizao de Cdigo para Placas Grficas

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Criao de uma anlise de cdigo que encontra falhas de segurana em programas PHP. Essa anlise j foi usada para detectar falhas em 32 programas PHP largamente usados.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: We have implemented and validated a tool that detects bugs in PHP programs. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O rastreamento de fluxo de informaao um dos grandes temas de pesquisa abordados pela comunidade de linguagens de programao. Dado uma "informao", o objetivo desse tipo de anlise identificar em que parte de um programa alvo tal conhecimento produzido, como ele se propaga entre as variveis desse programa, e que usurios podem ter acesso a ele.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Esta linha de pesquisa existe como decorrncia de uma cooperao cientfica que o candidato vem criando com uma empresa do ramo de rastreamento de veculos, a Maxtrack. Esta empresa foi criada por empreendedores mineiros, e hoje lder em seu mercado no Brasil, tendo j projetado, implementado e distribudo rastreadores para veculos automotores e trens de carga. O objetivo dessa cooperao cientfica projetar, implementar e instalar servios de teste de software que possam ser usados para ativar, de forma automtica, potenciais falhas de segurana em cdigo feito para sistemas embarcados.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Paralelizao Automtica de Cdigo para Dispositivos Mveis
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto trata-se de uma cooperao entre a Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais e a empresa LG Electronics, e existe no contexto da Lei de Informtica e Inovao. O objetivo deste projeto desenvolver tcnicas que permitam a gerao de cdigo paralelo para dispositivos mveis como smartphones. O resultado esperado deste projeto um compilador capaz de assinalar as diferentes partes de um programa a uma CPU multicore, ou a GPU que existe em um smartphone.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Register Allocation via Coloring of Chordal Graphs
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project consists in the design and implementation of a non-iterative algorithm for register allocation based on graph coloring. We present a simple, linear-time algorithm which is competitive with the iterated register coalescing strategy of George and Appel. We base the new algorithm on the observation that more than 95% of the methods in the Java 1.5 library have chordal interference graphs. A greedy algorithm can color a chordal graph optimally in linear time, and we can easily add powerful heuristics for spilling and coalescing. Our experimental results show that the new algorithm produces better results than iterated register coalescing for settings with few registers and comparable results for settings with many registers. The implementation of the proposed algorithm, as well as our implementation of the iterated register coalesing algorithm can be downloaded in the links below.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo apresenta a linguagem usada no modelo de coordenao denominado PeerSpaces. PeerSpaces define uma infra-estrutura para comunicao entre processos, sincronizao e localizao de recursos em redes mveis ad hoc. O modelo de coordenao proposto em PeerSpaces baseado no conceito de espaos de tuplas, proposto originalmente em Linda. PeerSpaces, no entanto, substitui a arquitetura cliente/servidor, tradicionalmente usada em implementaes de Linda, por uma arquitetura peer-to-peer. Argumenta-se no artigo que esta arquitetura mais apropriada para coordenao de aplicaes em cenrios de computao mvel e ad hoc.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo apresentou um simulador para o modelo de coordenao de redes mveis ad-hoc denominado PeerSpaces. A fim de demonstrar como aplicaes distribudas poderiam ser desenvolvidas sobre este modelo, foi mostrado como implementar uma aplicacao capaz de detectar a terminao de uma determinada atividade em uma rede mvel ad-hoc.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo apresentou uma linguagem para especificao de L-Systems. L-Systems so mtodos para reescrita de cadeias de caracteres introduzidos pelo botnico Aristid Lindenmayer em 1968. A principal utilizao deste formalismo a modelagem de alguns tipos de fractais. LinF permite que fractais tridimensionais sejam definidos e tambm possibilita que elementos aleatrios sejam utilizados para melhor simular seres vivos como plantas ou penas. O artigo tambm introduz cFleo, uma implementao de um interpretador de L-Systems baseado na linguagem LinF.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo apresenta o sistema RME, uma plataforma de middleware que prov aos desenvolvedores de aplicaes distribudas um servio de invocao remota de mtodos. RME foi desenvolvido sobre o perfil MIDP/CLDC da plataforma J2ME, a edio da linguagem Java voltada para dispositivos limitados computacionalmente, como aparelhos celulares e palmtops. A implementao de RME, baseada em uma srie de conhecidos padres de projeto, oferece aos desenvolvedores diversas opes de reconfigurao, o que a torna adequada tanto para pequenos dispositivos quanto para computadores dotados de recursos mais poderosos.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste artigo procuramos argumentar que sistemas distribudos apresentam suficientes diferenas em relao aos sistemas centralizados, a ponto de operaes remotas necessitarem de descries adicionais, que no so necessrias em operaes locais. Tais descries envolvem como o middleware responsvel pela operao remota dever lidar com a maior latncia, a possibilidade de falhas e a concorrncia presentes no ambiente distribudo.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Compilers use register coalescing to avoid generating code for copy instructions. For architectures with register aliasing such as x86, Smith, Ramsey, and Holloway (2004) presented a polynomial-time approach to register coalescing that runs on top of Chaitin-style register allocators, while Scholz and Eckstein (2002) presented an optimal, exponential-time approach. Both methods scale poorly in the presence of aggressive live range splitting, a technique normally used to avoid register spilling. In this paper we present two aliasing-aware coalescing techniques that work for programs in elementary form. This intermediate representation, introduced by Appel and George (2001), splits the live ranges of variables at each program point. Our first algorithm, Punctual Coalescing, runs in linear time, scales well, and comes with a correctness proof that we have checked with the Twelf theorem prover. Our second algorithm is the first ILP-based approach to coalescing with aliasing. By comparing this optimal coalescer with the punctual algorithm we show that Punctual Coalescing gives near-optimal results for program traces.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Compilers use register coalescing to avoid generating code for copy instructions. For architectures with register aliasing such as x86, Smith, Ramsey, and Holloway (2004) presented a polynomial-time approach to register coalescing that runs on top of Chaitin-style register allocators, while Scholz and Eckstein (2002) presented an optimal, exponential-time approach. Both methods scale poorly in the presence of aggressive live range splitting, a technique normally used to avoid register spilling. In this paper we present two aliasing-aware coalescing techniques that work for programs in elementary form. This intermediate representation, introduced by Appel and George (2001), splits the live ranges of variables at each program point. Our first algorithm, Punctual Coalescing, runs in linear time, scales well, and comes with a correctness proof that we have checked with the Twelf theorem prover. Our second algorithm is the first ILP-based approach to coalescing with aliasing. By comparing this optimal coalescer with the punctual algorithm we show that Punctual Coalescing gives near-optimal results for program traces.

Q.;PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO QUINTAO;QUINTAO, FERNANDO MAGNO PEREIRA;PEREIRA, FERNANDO M.Q.;PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO Q.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Tainted variable attacks originate from program inputs maliciously crafted to exploit vulnerabilities in web applications. Such attacks are common in server-side scripting languages, such as PHP. Data-flow analysis is a popular approach to detect them. They iteratively compute the abstract state (in this case, "tainted'' or "clean'') associated to every program variable at each program point. Existing algorithms for this problem run, in the worst-case, in cubic time on the number of program variables. This can be problematic for large programs. This paper presents a quadratic-time algorithm to tackle the tainted flow problem. Our experimental results show that our analysis is more efficient than previous approaches in both time and space.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Tainted variable attacks originate from program inputs maliciously crafted to exploit vulnerabilities in web applications. Such attacks are common in server-side scripting languages, such as PHP. Data-flow analysis is a popular approach to detect them. They iteratively compute the abstract state (in this case, "tainted'' or "clean'') associated to every program variable at each program point. Existing algorithms for this problem run, in the worst-case, in cubic time on the number of program variables. This can be problematic for large programs. This paper presents a quadratic-time algorithm to tackle the tainted flow problem. Our experimental results show that our analysis is more efficient than previous approaches in both time and space.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Trace compilation is a new technique used by just-in-time (JIT) compilers such as traceMonkey, the javaScript engine in the Mozilla Firefox browser. Contrary to traditional JIT machines, a trace compiler compiles only part of the source program, normally a linear path inside a heavily executed loop. Because the trace is compiled during the interpretation of the source program the JIT compiler has access to the values manipulated at run-time, a fact that opens the doors for very aggressive optimizations. This fact gives the compiler writer the possibility of improving code via partial evaluation techniques at run-time. In this paper we rely in this observation to present an analysis that removes unnecessary overflow tests from javaScript programs. Our optimization uses a variation of range analysis to estimate the lower and upper limits of the values assumed by variables during the execution of the program. Such information allows us to prove that some operations cannot produce overflows. Our analysis runs in linear time, in terms of both time and space, and is much more effective than traditional range analyses, as we have access to values known only at execution time. We have implemented it on top of traceMonkey, and our experiments show that it removes a considerable number of overflow tests without compromising the speed of the underlining JIT compiler.

Q.;PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO QUINTAO;QUINTAO, FERNANDO MAGNO PEREIRA;PEREIRA, FERNANDO M.Q.;PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO Q.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The increasing programability and the low cost of graphical processing units (GPUs), allied with their high computational power, make GPUs attractive to the general purpose programming community. However, the development of applications that are able to take full benefit of this execution environment is a challenging task. One of these challenges stems from divergences, a phenomenon that occurs when threads that execute in lock-step are forced to take different program paths due to branches in the code. In face of divergences, some threads will have to wait, idly, while their diverging siblings are processed, before being able to resume their execution. Optimizing the code to avoid divergences is difficult: because they are hard to detect, this task demands a deep understanding of programs that might be large and convoluted. In order to facilitate the detection of divergences, this paper introduces the divergence map, a data structure that indicates the location and the volume of divergences in a program. We build this map via a dynamic profiler that we have implemented on top of an open source CUDA compiler. To illustrate the importance of the divergence map, we have used it to pin-point the core regions that must be optimized in well known public applications. By performing some optimizations by hand, we have found speed-up opportunities in codes that have already gone through the sieve of many programmers.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Single Instruction, Multiple Data (SIMD) paradigm is a very common model of parallel programming in which the data is split among a collection of processing units that run concurrently. The increasing programmability and the decreasing cost of graphical processing units (GPUs), is contributing to make general purpose programming a reality in the SIMD world. However, coding general purpose applications in this paradigm is still a challenge, and one of the difficulties stem from divergent conditional tests. A branch is said to be divergent if it provides different outcomes to different threads. In this case, some threads will have to wait, idly, while the others execute. Application developers should be able to identify divergent branches, in order to optimize the application to mitigate the effects of divergences. However, that is a difficult task, because it requires knowledge about a program that might be large and complicated. In this paper we present a static analysis that determines with high probability the divergent branches in a program. The main contribution of this analysis is to free the application developer from the tedious and error prone task of manually identifying divergent branches. Our analysis runs in linear time on the number of variables in the source program. Our experiments show that it is fast, and precise enough to be useful in the development of parallel applications.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BIGONHA, Mariza de Andrade da Silva

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Static Single Information form (SSI) is a program representation that enables optimizations such as array bound checking elimination and conditional constant propagation. Transforming a program into SSI form has a non-negligible impact on compilation time; but, only a few SSI clients, that is, optimizations that use SSI, require a full conversion. This paper describes the SSI framework we have implemented for the LLVM compiler, and that is now part of this compiler's standard distribution. In our design, optimizing passes inform the compiler a list of variables of interest, which are then transformed to present, fully or partially, the SSI properties. It is provided to each client only the subset of SSI that the client needs. Our implementation orchestrates the execution of clients in sequence, avoiding redundant work when two clients request the conversion of the same variable. As empirically demonstrated, in the context of an industrial strength compiler, our approach saves compilation time and keeps the program representation small, while enabling a vast array of code optimizations.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: the 23rd international conference
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 23rd international conference on Parallel architectures and compilation - PACT '14

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Current high-performance multicore processors provide users with a non-uniform memory access model (NUMA). These systems perform better when threads access data on memory banks next to the core where they run. However, ensuring data locality is difficult. In this paper, we propose compiler analyses and code generation methods to support a lightweight runtime system that dynamically migrates memory pages to improve data locality. Our technique combines static and dynamic analyses and is capable of identifying the most promising pages to migrate. Statically, we infer the size of arrays, plus the amount of reuse of each memory access instruction in a program. These estimates rely on a simple, yet accurate, trip count predictor of our own design. This knowledge lets us build templates of dynamic checks, to be filled with values known only at runtime. These checks determine when it is profitable to migrate data closer to the processors where this data is used. Our static analyses are quadratic on the number of variables in a program, and the dynamic checks are O(1) in practice. Our technique does not require any form of user intervention, neither the support of a third-party middleware, nor modifications in the operating system's kernel. We have applied our technique on several parallel algorithms, which are completely oblivious to the asymmetric memory topology, and have observed speedups of up to 4x, compared to static heuristics. We compare our approach against Minas, a middleware that supports NUMA-aware data allocation, and show that we can outperform it by up to 50% in some cases.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: the 2014 ACM International Conference
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2014 ACM International Conference on Object Oriented Programming Systems Languages & Applications - OOPSLA '14

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The C programming language does not prevent out-of-bounds memory accesses. There exist several techniques to secure C programs; however, these methods tend to slow down these programs substantially, because they populate the binary code with runtime checks. To deal with this problem, we have designed and tested two static analyses - symbolic region and range analysis - which we combine to remove the majority of these guards. In addition to the analyses themselves, we bring two other contributions. First, we describe live range splitting strategies that improve the efficiency and the precision of our analyses. Secondly, we show how to deal with integer overflows, a phenomenon that can compromise the correctness of static algorithms that validate memory accesses. We validate our claims by incorporating our findings into AddressSanitizer. We generate SPEC CINT 2006 code that is 17% faster and 9% more energy efficient than the code produced originally by this tool. Furthermore, our approach is 50% more effective than Pentagons, a state-of-the-art analysis to sanitize memory accesses.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Runtime Pointer Disambiguation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Runtime Pointer Disambiguation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of SPLASH

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: To optimize code effectively, compilers must deal with memory dependencies. However, the state-of-the-art heuristics available in the literature to track memory dependencies are inherently imprecise and computationally expensive. Consequently, the most advanced code transformations that compilers have today are ineffective when applied on real-world programs. The goal of this paper is to solve this conundrum through dynamic disambiguation of pointers. We provide different ways to determine at runtime when two memory locations can overlap. We then produce two versions of a code region: one that is aliasing-free - hence, easy to optimize - and another that is not. Our checks let us safely branch to the optimizable region. We have applied these ideas on Polly-LLVM, a loop optimizer built on top of the LLVM compilation infrastructure. Our experiments indicate that our method is precise, effective and useful: we can disambiguate every pair of pointer in the loop intensive \polybench benchmark suite. The result of this precision is code quality: the binaries we generate are 10% faster than those that Polly-LLVM produces without our optimization, at the -O3 optimization level of LLVM.

However, the state-of-the-art heuristics available in the literature to track memory dependencies are inherently imprecise and computationally expensive. The goal of this paper is to solve this conundrum through dynamic disambiguation of pointers. We provide different ways to determine at runtime when two memory locations can overlap. We then produce two versions of a code region: one that is aliasing-free - hence, easy to optimize - and another that is not. Our checks let us safely branch to the optimizable region. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Programming languages such as C for CUDA, OpenCL or ISPC have contributed to increase the programmability of SIMD accelerators and graphics processing units. However, these languages still lack the flexibility offered by low-level SIMD programming on explicit vectors. To close this expressiveness gap while preserving performance, this paper introduces the notion of \ourinvention{} (CREV). CREV allows changing the dimension of vectorization during the execution of a kernel, exposing it as a nested parallel kernel call. CREV affords programmability close to dynamic parallelism, a feature that allows the invocation of kernels from inside kernels, but at much lower cost. In this paper, we present a formal semantics of CREV, and an implementation of it on the ISPC compiler. We have used CREV to implement some classic algorithms, including string matching, depth first search and Bellman-Ford, with minimum effort. These algorithms, once compiled by ISPC to Intel-based vector instructions, are as fast as state-of-the-art implementations, yet much simpler. Thus, CREV gives developers the elegance of dynamic programming, and the performance of explicit SIMD programming.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Pointer disambiguation via strict inequalities
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Pointer disambiguation via strict inequalities

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2017 IEEE/ACM International Symposium on Code Generation and Optimization (CGO)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2017 IEEE/ACM International Symposium on Code Generation and Optimization (CGO)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The design and implementation of static analyses that disambiguate pointers has been a focus of research since the early days of compiler construction. One of the challenges that arise in this context is the analysis of languages that support pointer arithmetics, such as C, C++ and assembly dialects. This paper contributes to solve this challenge. We start from an obvious, yet unexplored, observation: if a pointer is strictly less than another, they cannot alias. Motivated by this remark, we use abstract interpretation to build strict less-than relations between pointers. We construct a program representation that bestows the Static Single Information (SSI) property onto our dataflow analysis. SSI gives us a sparse algorithm, whose correctness is easy to ensure. We have implemented our static analysis in LLVM. It runs in time linear on the number of program variables, and, depending on the benchmark, it can be as much as six times more precise than the pointer disambiguation techniques already in place in that compiler.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2017 26th International Conference on Computer Communication and Networks (ICCCN)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Decades went by since Mark Weiser published his influential work on how a computer of the 21st century would look like. Over the years, some of the UbiComp features presented in that paper have been gradually adopted by industry players in the technology market. While this technological evolution resulted in many benefits to our society, it has also posed, along the way, countless challenges that we have yet to surpass. In this paper, we address major challenges from two areas that most afflict the UbiComp revolution: security and privacy. We examine open problems on software protection, long-term security, cryptography engineering, and privacy implications. We also point out promising directions towards the solutions of those problems. We claim that if we get all this right, we will turn the science fiction of UbiComp into science fact.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Profiling divergences in GPU applications

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: PEREIRA, Fernando Magno Quinto;Pereira, Fernando Magno Quinto;QUINTAO PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO;QUINTO PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO;MAGNO QUINTO PEREIRA, FERNANDO;QUINTO PEREIRA, FERNANDO M.;MAGNO QUINTAO PEREIRA, FERNANDO;PEREIRA, FERNANDO M. Q.;PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO QUINTAO;QUINTAO, FERNANDO MAGNO PEREIRA;PEREIRA, FERNANDO M.Q.;PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO Q.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The increasing programmability and the high computational power of graphics processing units make them attractive to general purpose programming. However, taking full benefit of this execution environment is a challenging task. One of these challenges stems from divergences, a phenomenon that occurs when threads that execute in lock-step are forced to take different program paths because of branches in the code. In face of divergences, some threads will have to wait, idly, while their diverging siblings execute. Optimizing the code to avoid divergences is difficult because this task demands a deep understanding of programs that might be large and convoluted. To facilitate the detection of divergences, this paper introduces the divergence map, a data structure that indicates the location and the volume of divergences in a program. We build this map via dynamic profiling techniques, which we have implemented on top of an open source Parallel Thread Execution compiler. To illustrate the importance of the divergence map, we have used it to pinpoint the core regions that must be optimized in well-known public applications. By hand optimizing some applications, we have added 9?11% speedups onto kernels that have already gone through the sieve of many programmers.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Automatic parallelization of canonical loops

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: PEREIRA, Fernando Magno Quinto;Pereira, Fernando Magno Quinto;QUINTAO PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO;QUINTO PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO;MAGNO QUINTO PEREIRA, FERNANDO;QUINTO PEREIRA, FERNANDO M.;MAGNO QUINTAO PEREIRA, FERNANDO;PEREIRA, FERNANDO M. Q.;PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO QUINTAO;QUINTAO, FERNANDO MAGNO PEREIRA;PEREIRA, FERNANDO M.Q.;PEREIRA, FERNANDO MAGNO Q.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a compilation technique that performs the automatic parallelization of canonical loops. Canonical loops are a recurring pattern that we have observed in many well known algorithms, such as frequent itemset, K-means and K nearest neighbors. Our compiler translates C code to sequences of stream ﬁlters that communicate through a variety of channel types. We analyze code containing canonical loops, separate the data over a cluster of processors and determine suitable communication strategies between these processors. Experiments performed on a cluster of 36 computers show that, for the three algorithms described above, our method produces speed-ups that are almost linear on the number of available processors. These experiments also show that the code automatically generated is competitive when compared to hand tuned programs

These experiments also show that the code automatically generated is competitive when compared to hand tuned programs

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Divergence analysis

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: ACM Transactions on Programming Languages and Systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The growing interest in graphics processing units has brought renewed attention to the Single Instruction Multiple Data (SIMD) execution model. SIMD machines give application developers tremendous computational power; however, programming them is still challenging. In particular, developers must deal with memory and control flow divergences. These phenomena stem from a condition that we call data divergence, which occurs whenever two processing elements (PEs) see the same variable name holding different values. This paper introduces divergence analysis, a static analysis that discovers data divergences. This analysis, currently deployed in an industrial quality compiler, is useful in several ways: it improves the translation of SIMD code to non-SIMD CPUs, it helps developers to manually improve their SIMD applications, and it also guides the automatic optimization of SIMD programs. We demonstrate this last point by introducing the notion of a divergence aware register spiller. This spiller uses information from our analysis to either rematerialize or share common data between PEs. As a testimony of its effectiveness, we have tested it on a suite of 395 CUDA kernels from well-known benchmarks. The divergence aware spiller produces GPU code that is 26.21% faster than the code produced by the register allocator used in the baseline compiler.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Just-in-time value specialization

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: JavaScript emerges today as one of the most important programming languages for the development of client-side web applications. Therefore, it is essential that browsers be able to execute JavaScript programs efficiently. However, the dynamic nature of this programming language makes it very challenging to achieve this much needed efficiency. In this paper we propose parameter-based value specialization as a way to improve the quality of the code produced by JIT engines. We have empirically observed that almost 60% of the JavaScript functions found in the world's 100 most popular websites are called only once, or are called with the same parameters. Capitalizing on this observation, we adapt a number of classic compiler optimizations to specialize code based on the runtime values of function's actual parameters. We have implemented the techniques proposed in this paper in IonMonkey, an industrial quality JavaScript JIT compiler developed at the Mozilla Foundation. Our experiments, run across three popular JavaScript benchmarks, SunSpider, V8 and Kraken, show that, in spite of its highly speculative nature, our optimization pays for itself. As an example, we have been able to speed up V8 by 4.83%, and to reduce the size of its generated native code by 18.84%.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Thread scheduling and memory coalescing for dynamic vectorization of SPMD workloads
A case for a fast trip count predictor
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A case for a fast trip count predictor

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Trip Count of a loop determines how many iterations this loop performs. Predicting this value is important for several compiler optimizations, which yield greater benefits for large trip counts, and are either innocuous or detrimental for small ones. However, finding an exact prediction, in general, is an undecidable problem. Such problems are usually approached via methods which tend to be computationally expensive. In this paper we make a case for a cheap trip count prediction heuristic, which is O(1)O(1) on the size of the loop. We argue that our technique is useful to just-in-time compilers. If we predict that a loop will iterate for a long time, then we invoke the JIT compiler earlier. Even though straightforward, our observation is novel. We show how this idea speeds up JavaScript programs, by implementing it in Mozilla Firefox. We can apply our heuristic in 79.9% of the loops found in typical JavaScript benchmarks. For these loops, we obtain exact predictions in 91% of cases. We get similar results when analyzing the C programs of SPEC CPU 2006. A more elaborate technique, linear on the size of the loop, improves our O(1)O(1) technique only marginally. As a consequence of this work, we have been able to speed up several JavaScript programs by over 5%, reaching 24% of improvement in one benchmark.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este programa permite que algoritmos distribudos baseados no modelo de coordenao denominado PeerSpaces sejam simulados. Algoritmos distribudos consistem de um conjunto de comandos guardados, isto , compostos por uma guarda e uma ao. Guardas so condies lgicas que, uma vez vlidas, permitem que a ao correspondente seja executada. Diversos algoritmos foram simulados, sendo que da simulao de um algoritmo de deteco de terminao resultou um artigo submetido no FIDJI, Luxemburgo.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Arcademis um arcabouo voltado para o desenvolvimento de sistemas de middleware. Os componentes que constituem este arcabouo formam um conjunto de classes abstratas, interfaces e componentes concretos, implementados em Java, que podem ser estendidos ou combinados de vrias maneiras a fim de gerar plataformas adequadas a diferentes cenrios. Dentre as vantagens da utilizao de Arcademis para o desenvolvimento de plataformas de middleware, cita-se a maior rapidez e a menor probabilidade de ocorrncia de erros de programao. Alm disto, sistemas obtidos a partir de Arcademis podem ser facilmente configurados, uma vez que cada componente do arcabouo pode ser modificado de forma independente dos demais. Alm disto, arquiteturas derivadas de Arcademis no constituem sistemas monolticos, pois no necessrio que a plataforma de middleware utilize todos os componentes do arcabouo.

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: United States Patent and Trademark Office

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We show that register allocation can be viewed as solving a collection of puzzles. We model the register file as a puzzle board and the program variables as puzzle pieces. We model pre-coloring by letting some of the puzzle pieces be already immovably placed on the puzzle board, and we model register aliasing by letting pieces have a plurality widths. For a wide variety of computer architectures, we can solve the puzzles in polynomial time. Puzzle solving is independent of spilling, that is, puzzle solving can be combined with a wide variety of approaches to spilling.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We show that register allocation can be viewed as solving a collection of puzzles. We model the register file as a puzzle board and the program variables as puzzle pieces. Script uma linguagem funcional cujo propsito principal prover uma notao adequada para a descrio dos aspectos lxicos, sintticos e semnticos de linguagens de programao. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This technical report presents a Java-based simulator for the PeerSpaces coordination model. PeerSpaces is a shared space coordination model designed for ad hoc mobile networks. The model is based on the concept of tuple spaces firstly proposed by Linda parallel programming language. In order to suit well the dynamic environment that characterizes ad hoc networks, PeerSpaces does not assume the presence of any centralized structure for communication and coordination. This report also describes an algorithm for termination detection in ad hoc networks built on PeerSpaces using the proposed simulator.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Semntica Formal uma rea da Cincia da Computao que engloba diversos formalismos diferentes, embora todos eles possam ser utilizados para a especificao de linguagens de programao. Ainda que estes formalismos visem prover uma notao concisa e no ambgua para a realizao de especificaes formais, no se pode dizer que so equivalentes. Este relatrio fornece uma comparao entre quatro dos mais populares modelos formais utilizados na definio semntica de linguagens de programao, a saber: semntica denotacional, pi-clculo, semntica operacional estruturada e mquinas de estado abstratas.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This report provides a short description about the general structure of Arcademis, a framework for middleware development. The architecture of this framework is divided into 12 configurable parts, and each of these groups is described in the report. Additionally, the report presents RME, the middleware instance of Arcademis that targets resource constrained devices, such as cell phones.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O objetivo deste curso ensinar o aluno a desenvolver aplicativos para dispositivos mveis usando a plataforma android. Android programado em Java, e essa ser, portanto, a linguagem utilizada durante toda a disciplina. Conhecimento prvio de Java no um pr-requisito para o curso. Porm, sendo esse um curso de programao, pressupe-se que o aluno possua alguma familiaridade com uma ou mais linguagens de programao. Durante o curso o aluno ir aprender a desenvolver interfaces grficas, usar a API de localizao do google, manipular recursos de telefonia e comunicao distribuda. Durante o curso sero tambm vistas algumas boas prticas de programao embora esse no seja o foco principal da disciplina.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-CURSOS-CURTA-DURACAO-MI.TITULO: Code Generation Techniques for Graphics Processing Units
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-CURSOS-CURTA-DURACAO-MI.TITULO-INGLES: Code Generation Techniques for Graphics Processing Units

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Books on parallel programming theory often talk about such weird beasts like the PRAM model, a hypothetical hardware that would provide the programmer with a number of processors that is proportional to the input size of the problem at hand. Modern general purpose computers afford only a few processing units; four is currently a reasonable number. This limitation makes the development of highly parallel applications quite difficult to the average computer user. However, the low cost and the increasing programmability of graphics processing units, popularly know as GPUs, is contributing to overcome this difficulty. Presently, the application developer can have access, for a few dollars, to a hardware boosting hundreds of processing elements. This brave new world that is now open to many programmers brings, alongside the incredible possibilities, also difficulties and challenges. Perhaps, for the first time since the popularization of computers, it makes sense to open the compiler books on the final chapters, which talk about very unusual concepts, such as polyhedral loops, iteration space and Fourier-Motzkin transformations, only to name a few islands in this enchanted ocean. This material consists of a three-days course, that covers, in a very condensed way, some code generation and optimization techniques that a compiler would use to produce efficient code for graphics processing units. Through these techniques, the compiler writer tries to free the application developer from the intricacies and subtleties of GPU programming, giving him more freedom to focus on algorithms instead of micro-optimizations. We will discuss a little bit of what are GPUs, which applications should target them, how the compiler sees a GPU program and how the compiler can transform this program so that it will take more from this very powerful hardware.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The goal of this class is to introduce the student to the most recent techniques that compilers use to analyze and optimize programs. The student will learn about dataflow and constraint based program analyses. He or she will have contact with type systems, and the many variants of inductive techniques to prove properties about programs. The class contains a number of expositive lectures, and some paper discussion. During the discussions, the students will have the opportunity to get in touch with state-of-the-art techniques published in top conferences in the field of programming languages. The class also features three project assignment, which will give the student the opportunity to use llvm, a industrial quality compiler, and twelf, a theorem prover.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Brazilian Conference on Software: Theory and Practice (CBSoft) is one of the major events held annually by the Brazilian Computer Society, with the intention of promoting and encouraging the exchange of experiences between the scientific, academic and professional communities about the latest research, trends and innovations - practical and theoretical - in software. In addition to the Short Courses, Tutorials and Workshops, the CBSoft programming integrates four traditional events organized by the Brazilian community of software development.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A aritmtica de inteiros em C e C++ marcada pela semntica do envelopamento. Se um nmero maior que o maior valor representado pelo tipo inteiro, ento apenas seus bits menos significativos so armazenados naquele tipo de dados. Alguns compiladores inserem no cdigo binrio testes para verificar a ocorrncia de overflows. O objetivo desse projeto desenvolver tcnicas de anlise esttica de cdigo que eliminem alguns desses testes de programas escritos em C e C++.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O desempenho limitado pelo consumo de energia em arquiteturas de computadores modernas. Uma forma de reduzir o consumo de energia e, consequentemente, aumentar o desempenho, eliminar operaes redundantes entre as instrues de mquina. Esta eliminao de redundncia, contudo, difcil, porque envolve a soluo de um problema caro durante a execuo: a super-sequncia mais curta. Trabalhos anteriores propuseram muitas heursticas diferentes para resolver este problema a nvel de arquitetura ou a nvel de compilador. O grande nmero de diferentes algoritmos, e o vasto espao de busca fazem com que uma comparao entre eles uma tarefa herclea. Nesta dissertao, ns mergulhamos nesta tarefa, fornecendo a mais extensa anlise comparativa destas diferentes heursticas j vista na literatura. Ns combinamos as diferentes heursticas em vrias dimenses, incluindo a quantidade de paralelismo a nvel de thread e a nvel de dados. Os nossos resultados mostram que a heurstica relativamente simples, tais como uma heurstica chamada Min-SP-PC, pode superar algoritmos muito complicados. A partir dessa comparao traamos subsdios para projetar, testar e implementar novas heursticas para compartilhar o trabalho redundante entre threads paralelas. Os nossos novos algoritmos melhoraram os trabalhos anteriores de maneiras no-triviais. Ao testar estes algoritmos em benchmarks de fora industrial, ns observamos que alguns deles so capazes de reduzir o nmero de instrues a serem processadas por um fator de 3x.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Runtime Value Specialization

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: JavaScript is nowadays the lingua franca of web browsers. Today this programming language is not only the main tool that developers have to implement the client side of web applications, but is also the target of frameworks such as the Google Web Toolkit. Given this importance, it is fundamental that JavaScript programs can be executed efficiently. Just-in-time (JIT) compilation is one of the keys to achieve this much necessary efficiency. An advantages that a JIT compiler has over a traditional compiler is the possibility to use runtime values to specialize the target code. In this project we push JIT speculation to a new extreme: we have empirically observed that many JavaScript functions are called only once during a typical browser section. A natural way to capitalize on this observation is to specialize the code produced by a function to the particular values that are passed to this function as parameters. We have implemented this approach on IonMonkey, the newest JIT compiler used in the Mozilla Firefox browser. By coupling this type of parameter specialization with classical compiler optimizations, such as constant propagation and global value numbering, we have been able to experimentally observe speedups of 25% on well-known algorithms. These gains are even more remarkable because they have been obtained over a worldly known, industrial quality JavaScript runtime environment.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: The Design and Implementation of a Non-Iterative Range Analysis Algorithm
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: The Design and Implementation of a Non-Iterative Range Analysis Algorithm

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The goal of this project was to design and implement the first non-iterative range analysis algorithm in a production compiler. Discrete range analyses try to discover the intervals of values that may be bound to the integer variables during program execution. This information enables compiler optimizations such as dead code elimination and the detection of bugs such as buffer overflow vulnerabilities. So far, non-iterative range analysis algorithms have been constrained to theoretical works - actual implementations never reaching the boundaries of industrial strength compilers. In this paper we fix this omission by implementing in the LLVM compiler the constraint system that Su and Wagner designed in 2005. In the effort to implement this method in an actual compiler we had to modify Su's algorithm in many ways. In particular, we use Gawlitza's algorithm to handle program loops, and Bodik's Extended Static Single Assignment form to add flow sensitiveness to our analysis. We have tested this analysis with a compiler optimization that converts 32-bit variables to either 8-bit or 16-bit variables whenever possible. Our implementation of range analysis has been able to process over 4 million assembly instructions in 223 seconds, yielding results on par with previous works.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Optimizing a Geomodeling Domain Specific Language
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: Optimizing a Geomodeling Domain Specific Language

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The goal of this project is to optimize Dinamica EGO, a domain specific languages (DSL) for geomodeling. Dinamica EGO provides users with a rich suite of operators available in a script language and in a graphical interface, which they can use to process information extracted from geographic entities, such as maps and tables. We analyze this language through the lens of compiler writers. Under this perspective we describe a key optimization that we have implemented on top of the Dinamica EGO execution environment. This optimization consists in the systematic elimination of memory copies that Dinamica EGO uses to ensure referential transparency. Our algorithm is currently part of the official distribution of this framework. We show, via a real-life case study, that our optimization can speedup geomodeling applications by almost 100x.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Dynamic Pointer Disambiguation

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de Minas Gerais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In order to effectively optimize loops, we must solve the alias analysis problem. However, the state-of-the-art heuristics available in the literature are inherently imprecise and computationally expensive. Consequently, the most advanced loop optimizations that we have today are ineffective when applied on real-world programs. The goal of this paper is to solve this conundrum. We propose a mechanism to disambiguate pointers at runtime. Our technique consists in generating dynamic tests to determine when two memory locations can overlap. We then produce two versions of a loop: one that is aliasing-free - hence, easy to optimize - and another that is not. Our checks lets us safely branch to the optimizable region. We have applied these ideas on Polly-LLVM, a loop optimizer built on top of the LLVM compilation infrastructure. Our experiments indicate that our method is precise, effective and useful: we can disambiguate the vast majority of checks in benchmarks that go from the loop intensive Polybench suite to the more general SPEC CPU 2006 benchmark collection. The result of this precision is code quality: the binaries that we generate are 12% faster than those that Polly-LLVM produces without our optimization. Given the current technology to statically solve alias analysis, we believe that our ideas are a necessary step to make loop optimizations useful in practice.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A compilao just-in-time um dos mecanismos mais efetivos que linguagens virtualizadas possuem para prover aos seus usurios alto desempenho. Essa tecnologia permite que um programa seja compilado para cdigo nativo enquanto ele interpretado. Um dos grandes desafios relacionados compilao just-in-time descobrir o melhor momento para invocar o compilador. Se a invocao ocorre muito cedo, maior a chance de que o tempo de execuo do programa no seja grande o suficiente para amortizar o custo da compilao. Por outro lado, uma invocao tardia pode fazer com que cdigo crtico seja interpretado durante um tempo muito longo. O objetivo deste trabalho descrever uma heurstica que determina, dinamicamente, quais programas tendem a executar durante longo tempo. A heurstica que propomos de extraordinria simplicidade: antes de interpretarmos a execuo de um lao, ns verificamos os valores usados em sua condio de trmino. Temos acesso a tais valores, uma vez que estamos gerando cdigo para um programa durante a sua interpretao. No obstante sua simplicidade, nossa heurstica surpreendentemente precisa: resultados empricos obtidos sobre uma vasta coleo de programas JavaScript, demonstram uma taxa de acerto de mais de 60%. Ns implementamos essa heurstica no navegador Firefox, e fomos capazes de aumentar o desempenho de benchmarks conhecidos em at 91%. Essa mesma tcnica possui preciso similar em linguagens estaticamente compiladas. Instrumentao inserida via LLVM nos permitiu prever, com uma taxa de acerto por volta de 60%, a quantidade exata de iteraes dos laos encontrados nos programas C disponveis em SPEC CPU 2006.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Um servio de invocao remota de mtodos possibilita aos desenvolvedores de aplicaes utilizar os princpios da programao orientada por objetos ainda que os componentes utilizados no se encontrem todos no mesmo espao de endereamento. Um dos problemas com a invocao remota o fato de a aplicao permanecer bloqueada enquanto a chamada est sendo remotamente processada, ainda que tal no seja necessrio. Um servio de invocao assncrona permite que a aplicao continue o seu fluxo normal de execuo enquanto suas chamadas remotas so processadas por objetos distribudos. Este servio de invocao assncrona foi implementado sobre RME, um servio de invocao de mtodos desenvolvido para o perfil CLDC da plataforma J2ME.
